Thank you for your inquiry regarding the storage of customer data in a US-based cloud provider. I appreciate your attention to compliance, especially concerning the sensitive nature of employee HR data.

As per our compliance policy under the EU Data Protection Regulation (EDPR), it is essential to ensure that any transfer of personal data outside of the EU adheres to strict guidelines. Specifically, the EDPR mandates that data can only be stored in non-EU regions if the receiving entity complies with the "Data Safe Harbor Protocol," which guarantees an equivalent level of data protection as required within the EU.

Given that the US does not provide an automatic equivalence under the EDPR framework, we generally advise against storing employee HR data with US-based cloud providers unless they have been certified under the Data Safe Harbor Protocol or a similar compliance framework that meets EU standards.

Therefore, for the storage of employee HR data in accordance with our policies and regulatory requirements, we recommend utilizing cloud services based within the EU or those that provide verified compliance with the necessary protections.
